conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions Committee, I’m Student_A and School_B is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly value your academic environment and would commit enthusiastically if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately rather than risk losing its single seat. Although School_B ranks me last in its priority list, applying now is still my best chance; delaying won’t improve my priority and could let higher-priority students claim the only spot. I will emphasize strong fit and commitment to encourage acceptance if they have discretion.

conversation.message: Dear Student_A, thank you for your application and for naming School_B as your first choice. conversation.thought: School_B has quota 1 and priority order E > B > C > D > A. In this round, I received APPLY from A, C, and D. Among these, C is ranked higher than D, and D higher than A. Since accepting A now would lock in my only seat and prevent matching with a higher-priority applicant (C or D) who is currently applying and says School_B is first choice, I should reject A to preserve the seat for a better-ranked student. There is also a possibility of even higher-ranked E or B applying later, so rejecting A is additionally justified.
